title: So, Riot wants ranked to be a team experience...
body:
And then you prevent diamond+ players from queueing as five?

Like, I get your reasoning here, Riot. Diamond+ have dumb queue times, and it's really unfair to have a bunch of master+ friends have to face a professional team in ranked, and and it's a minority of the playerbase...

But seriously, if you're going to make the ranked experience be focused on teamplay and communication for most of the ladder, having that change when you hit diamond is kind of dumb.

replies.body:
At the top of the ladder... where competition is fiercest and teamwork mandatory for the highest caliber of gameplay which we here at Riot want to promote, teams are now only allowed to queue with up to a 3-man premade.

Wut?
I mean it almost sounds like individual players grouping as a team is easier to balance then a pre-made 4-5 man group, in fact it makes you wonder why there is not a solo Queue if that is the case.
Well, umm, isn't obvious by now that Riot is kind of dumb?
Yeah, they're dumb enough to make one of the most profitable games of this generation, if not the most profitable.
These asshats had nothing to do with the creation of LoL.  They may well have a lot to do with its demise though...

So not only they show middle finger to solo players, but also to high level 5-man teams (their future LCS material). 
Means, the target audience is 2-3 man premade casuals, also smurfs boosting their 1-2 low elo "friends" to gold for dem season rewards in a 5-man premade.

Thank you, among all the ragers and trolls, finally, a **valid** critic! So, well, take a +1 just for not being an A-hole and using basic logic, that's how desperate I am right now.

That being said, I'll play Devil's Advocate here. Riot was probly not happy about this decision. They must've seen the problem just as well as yourself. Thing is, great principles are nice and all, but you need to be pragmatic. If Daimond+ cannot play (or not in the right conditions), you need a solution, even if it means compromising with your philosophy.

The issue was that premade 5's were going against premade 1-3's at a rate of 1 per 250 games in Diamond, and 1 per 25 games in Master. This is compared to the 1 per 1000 games it happens to Plat and below (this is slightly higher for plat). The queue times factor in because to always match premade 5's with premade 5's (or at least with accuracy it has in lower elo's) it would kill the queue times even more.
Well they did mention they'd like to set up a 5v5 queue during peak hours but that would be an insured 5 premade vs 5 premade without the scary thought of five solos up against SKT.

Well to me that says the only way their dynamic queue works is if they change what it allows when constantly every hour on the hour?

 I don't know about you but if a match making system needs to change stuff like number of players allowed depending on the time of day then maybe that is a system that does not work and should be removed and replaced with a solo system that was more or less proven to work? then add a 5 man queue but remove the frustration points of having limited team invites/slots.
Itll probably be something like saturday evenings, so that all the high elo teams plan to play then, and get matched easily. Thats a pretty standard way of handling these situations.
standard since dynamic was released maybe, but what if all the high elo teams change their practice times? is riot going to hire a team to stalk all the professional teams?

I imagine riot would just set a time and expect the teams to conform to it. Much like how a small theater would do one screening a day and expect people to come at that time, rather than just run all day for whoever wanders in. Not the best metaphor but what they have in common is that ideally the consumers show up at a specific time.

You're slightly misunderstanding what they want to do. It's not change what is allowed every hour on the hour. It's a consistent time where something is allowed/disallowed. 

E.g., in OCE only the weekends have Twisted Treeline because there isn't the population to support the queue during the week. Same principle with this. You pick the time(s) where the most people play in D+ and allow 5 man pre-mades.

Actually 5v5 has always had a problem of too few users to do good matchmaking. Since everyone has different schedules queue times were pretty crazy. My guess is this would mean 5v5s only from like 2-10 PM every day or something like that. 

And the thing is that high elo has never worked which is why they all have like 3-4 smurf accounts. It's such a small community that they have to work out special cases for them

Yes and i get that it had its issues, which they never even attempted to address they just went straight towards lets force solo Q players to deal with ranked 5's.

They never experimented with disabling the team limits for ranked teams or granting unlimited invites/ having a core roster followed by a 25 man reserve roster; I myself rarely did ranked 5's simply because the system artificially limited how many people we could have on our team or invite so if anyone left the team we were shafted.

It is simple, the system ia flawed as fuck, and the flaw gets more serious and has a bigger impact once it reaches higher elo, to the point that even with how biased rito is toward DQ they can't keep it up any more and has to take it down.

they are acting as if the problem doesn't exist in lower ranks, except high elo is just a miniature of rest of the elos.
What riot want is casual premades, they are the most likely to $$$ for skin/champs/stuff
Right now, a full lobby of Diamond ranked players are not allowed?

They've stated that they're planning on limiting the amount of people in diamond+ lobbies to 3 or less in order to help with queue times.

I don't think it's out yet.
Its a band-aid solution to solve the queue time issues while they invent a real solution to the problems of ranked.

Ooh yes and no. High MMR is and always be the edge cases and they will always need extra 'band-aid' fixes/conditionals. It's unfortunate but it's the way it is. They might come up with a better fix, but it'll always have some problems by it's very nature.

yup just like solo queue not being a thing until they had the two weeks needed to implement it, or insert champion they ruined but said they would continue to iterate on here while actually abandoning them after several weeks of silence.

I guess theyre worried about the competitiveness of high elo. Theyre focusing on making low elo more fun because its definitionally never gonna be competitive (low elo = people who dont play at a high level).

Yes yes the boards hate premades but im willing to bet there are more people who like bringing their friends to ranked and since low elo is a clownfest anyway, let them have their fun.

The competitiveness is collateral of queue times. It's queue times that are the real issue. Because the queue times are so long, they have to weaken the range of allowable MMR and that is what makes the competitiveness poor. This change is aimed at increasing the pool of player-groups (e.g., 3x5 Man groups is now 5x3 man groups). If there are more groups/people to try and match with the queue times improve and the system never has to look for lower MMR people to fill in the gap.

the competitiveness of high elo is 5v5 ranked teams.

solo queue is essentially meaningless.

that is why you had the Challenger Series before, for the top 5v5 ranked teams.

So not only has dynamic queue destroyed legitimate solo rankings so nobody knows how good you are individually anymore, it also has destroyed competitiveness of high diamond/master/challenger tiers who play in serious LCS contender teams.
I'm more annoyed that they removed ranked 5v5. They Want team based ranked play, and then remove dedicated team based ranked from the game. Fucking ridiculous.

Did you even watch the video?
They stated they don't like the idea either, but SOMETHING has to give to fix the queue time problem at high MMR.
They aren't willing to significantly sacrifice queue times or match quality. The last point they could force some give on was position selection. Queuing as 4/5 gave you a much higher chance of either getting your role, or a teammate getting it and trading it to you. So between the Queue limit and forced autofill after a duration, they have had to make some concessions with their goals in order to provide a better experience for the players.

Lol, so it's not only low elo that's gotta suffer. 

I'm fine with this.
